Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Perché assistere al cambiamento, quando puoi guidarlo? In Accenture, potrai crescere in un ambiente inclusivo e rispettoso della tua unicità e dei tuoi valori, sviluppando le tue abilità con programmi di training continuativi ed esperienziali. Scopri cosa significa lavorare al cuore del cambiamento e accompagna le aziende più importanti nel loro percorso di trasformazione digitale. Il tuo ruolo e le tue prospettive Entra a far parte del nostro network internazionale di talenti Technology in ambito Data & AI. Lavorerai con tecnologie innovative su progetti entusiasmanti, liberando la potenza dei dati e dell'intelligenza artificiale per trasformare i processi di business. In particolare, potrai:



Progettare e implementare modelli di dati specifici che aiutino a prendere decisioni aziendali migliori e più rapide attraverso l’analisi di una combinazione di dati esterni e interni


Modellare dati, creare pipeline di dati, implementare data lake, utilizzando framework di programmazione scalabili


Implementare procedure statistiche di qualità dei dati sulle sorgenti dati e applicare rigorose analisi iterative per supportare i data scientist nell'approvvigionamento e nella preparazione dei dati per visualizzarli e sintetizzare informazioni generando valore aziendale


Definire gli standard di gestione dei dati e delle politiche di gestione, quali, ad esempio, l'anonimizzazione



Se vuoi fare della tua passione una carriera e hai le seguenti caratteristiche, ti stiamo aspettando:



Hai terminato o stai per terminare un percorso di studi in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica o Statistica


Sei creativo, impari in fretta e ami pensare fuori dal coro


Sei appassionato e vuoi approfondire tematiche quali: Data Architecture, Data Warehouse, Data Modeling, Data Integration, Data Transformation, Data Visualization, Big Data Technologies (Cloudera, AWS, Azure, Google, Snowflake), Spark, Python, Kafka, etc.



Scopri di più su di noi

Accenture è un’azienda globale di servizi professionali con capacità avanzate in campo digitale, cloud e security. Combinando un’esperienza unica e competenze specialistiche in più di 40 settori industriali, fornisce servizi in ambito Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Industry X, Operations e Accenture Song, sostenuta dalla più ampia rete di Advanced Technology e Intelligent Operations centers a livello mondiale.

I nostri 750.000 talenti combinano ogni giorno tecnologia e ingegno umano, servendo clienti in oltre 120 Paesi.

Se desideri prepararti al meglio al nostro processo di selezione ti invitiamo a consultare la nostra sezione FAQ: https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/recruiting-faq-answers

Policy Qualora il tuo percorso di selezione andasse a buon fine, avrai la possibilità di aderire all’Accordo di smart working, ove compatibile con l’attività svolta, e lavorare da remoto secondo quanto previsto dalle policy aziendali. Per informazioni sulla nostra protezione della privacy art13 L.679/2016 (GDPR) vai su  https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/privacy-policy Accenture garantisce le pari opportunità.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a passionate Data Engineer to join our tech team at Agricola Moderna. Working closely with Scientists and Engineers, you will build and maintain the infrastructure that powers our data pipelines and machine learning systems. You will preside over the whole lifecycle of data, from their creation to the availability to end users. This is an opportunity to work with large, heterogeneous datasets generated from environmental sensors, cameras, industrial devices and more.




What You'll Do:

Design, implement and optimise data pipelines and architectures on AWS.
Develop systems that allow scientists to easily access, explore and analyse datasets.
Automate extraction and loading of data from various structured and unstructured sources.
Monitor data pipelines, debugging issues and ensuring optimal data flow.
Generate and serve KPIs through effective dashboards and reporting tools.
You will be expected to work on site for at least 3 days of the week.




What You Have:

M.Sc. degree in a relevant quantitative field (Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
2 or more years of professional experience.
A great degree of analytic reasoning, reliability and attention to detail.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and shell scripting.
Passion for data infrastructure and enabling advanced analytics.
Knowledge of AWS services (S3, EC2, EMR, Athena, Glue, etc.) is a plus.




About Agricola Moderna:




Agricola Moderna is a Vertical Farming company which is growing food for a better future by revolutionising agriculture. In our modern farming company we control the entire process from seed to store. Our farms use zero pesticides, 95% less water, and are 100+ times more productive on the same footprint of land than traditional agriculture. Agricola Moderna has developed a recognised brand by developing products that are better for the customer and the environment. Today we are formed by a multi-disciplined team with people from all over the world, with a strong R&D focus. Our team includes plant scientists, growers, data scientists, engineers, sales, marketing, technical operators and more. Agricola Moderna is currently building a state of the art farm located in Lombardy.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Work somewhere with the creativity of a scaleup and expertise of an enterprise.




We are looking for a savvy Data Engineer to join our growing team of analytics experts in Milan.

You’d be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as for improving data flow and collection for cross-functional teams. You’d support our AI Research Engineer, Machine Learning Engineers and Backend Developers on data initiatives, ensuring consistent data delivery architecture throughout ongoing projects.




Should you be successful, you would:




Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architectures
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional and business requirements
Identify, design, and implement improvements to internal practices: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of sources




What You Have




At least two years’ proven experience in a data engineer role
A degree in Computer Science, Applied Math, Informatics, Information Systems or similar
Experience building processes supporting data transformation, data structure, metadata, dependency and workload management
Advanced working knowledge and experience with relational databases, query authoring as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases, such as SQL and NoSQL
Experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architectures and data sets
Experience with Python or Scala.
Experience with distributed computing.
Hands-on experience with object-oriented design, coding, and testing patterns.
Knowledge of pipeline and workflow management tools (Airflow, Argo Workflows, …)
Experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Travis, Argo CD, Terraform...)
Good understanding of Cloud and data models (data warehouse, data lake) and current engineering practices such as distributed architecture.
Experience with MLOps is a plus.
Experience with HPC is a plus.




Who You Are




An enthusiastic individual, excited by the prospect of optimizing or even contributing to designing our company’s data architecture
An analytical thinker with a passion for data
Proactive, comfortable working alone or as part of a team
Super organized
Accurate, with strong attention to detail
Familiar with Agile development
Fluent in English




Perks




Learning Friday. If our team members know more, so do we. That’s why we give everyone a training budget that they can spend on books, online courses or other training materials.
Smart Working. Trains can be a drag, you can save some commuting time by working from home.
Salary is based on experience, and topped up with other bonuses.




About iGenius




Established in 2016 by Uljan Sharka, iGenius is an AI company on a mission to humanize and democratize business data with Crystal, our proprietary GPT for numbers platform.




Crystal takes a human-first approach that enables business users to have high value conversations with data, all in an easy to use intuitive platform.




By combining data science, machine learning and conversational AI, Crystal becomes a private AI brain for business data, providing organizations with instant, safe and relevant data insights leading to faster and better decision making and business growth.




iGenius announced the partnership with Cineca to create the first Italian Foundational Large Language Model to help companies and Public Administration leverage the benefits of Generative Artificial Intelligence.




With this collaboration, iGenius and Cineca are committed to shaping the future of Artificial Intelligence, giving Italy a leading perspective in the field of highly advanced technology.”

With a strong global presence, iGenius operates in 4 countries with offices in New York and Milan, the company headquarters.

The team counts +100 talented international professionals, highly skilled in AI, machine learning, data science, and software engineering.

Please review our Privacy Policy here https://bit.ly/2XAy1gj .

Title: Collaboratore/trice Ufficio Statistico
Description:
La Libera Università di Lingue e Comunicazione IULM ricerca una risorsa da inserire come Data Analyst all’interno dell’Ufficio Statistico, Valutazione e Qualità.

 

Il profilo si occuperà di:

elaborazione ed analisi dati nell'ambito delle statistiche settoriali ed aziendali (ivi comprese le rilevazioni di customer satisfaction)
preparazione di rapporti di ricerca / indagine
progettazione di indagini quali/quantitative (in particolare CAWI)
supporto del sistema di valutazione, accreditamento e qualità dell'Ateneo

 

Requisiti:

 

laurea magistrale in materie statistico-economiche
utilizzo corrente di un software di analisi statistica dei dati (preferibilmente SPSS)
nozioni (anche basilari) di database (preferibilmente Oracle) e linguaggio SQL
ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office (in particolar modo nell'utilizzo di fogli di calcolo)
discreta conoscenza della lingua inglese (B1)
spiccata propensione al lavoro di squadra e all'apprendimento
buona capacità analitica, flessibilità nell'adattamento ai diversi compiti e orientamento al risultato
costituisce titolo preferenziale una esperienza almeno annuale nel settore della ricerca sociale, valutazione o assicurazione qualità

  

Sede di lavoro: Milano

 

Contratto e Durata: 

Livello ed inquadramento saranno valutati sulla base del profilo del/la candidato/a.

Title: Junior IT Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo è un gruppo bancario internazionale, leader in Italia e fra i primi 5 gruppi dell'area euro con oltre 20 milioni di clienti in Italia e all’estero. Estremamente innovativo è anche motore di crescita sostenibile e inclusiva, con impatto concreto sulla società e con un forte impegno per l’ambiente.

Scopo e attività

Stiamo cercando un Junior IT Infrastructure Engineer da inserire all'interno dell'ufficio Dc Sist Workspace And Endpoint Service Execution.

Il candidato verrà inserito nel Team di Programmazione e Delivery che si occupa costantemente di definire, quantificare e soddisfare le esigenze delle strutture interne della banca in termini di dotazioni tecnologiche personali (ad esempio PC, smartphone, ecc.) e funzionali all'operatività della banca (ad esempio monitor informativi, dispositivi per la gestione del contante, ecc.), mantenendo sempre l'adeguatezza nel tempo e la razionalizzazione del parco hardware installato.

Tra Le Principali Attività


analizzare con gli utenti della Banca i requisiti e le necessità;
predisporre le stime economiche e gestire il budget assegnato;
programmare l'approvvigionamento del materiale hardware necessario al raggiungimento degli obiettivi;
pianificare le attività previste, anche in team con altri colleghi e altre strutture, garantendo il rispetto dei tempi e dei costi condivisi con il Business;
gestire la relazione con i fornitori e i clienti interni.


Esperienza Richiesta

È richiesta un'esperienza di 1-2 anni in ambito IT su progetti di media complessità.

Qualifiche Richieste, Skills e Competenze


Ottima conoscenza delle principali fasi progettuali di un progetto di delivery e delle metodologie di pianificazione e monitoraggio dei progetti, di stima e budgeting progettuale.
Esperienza nella gestione delle dinamiche di gruppo tipiche di progetti con diversi stakeholder e team di lavoro geograficamente distribuiti.
Buona conoscenza tecnica in ambito distribuito (PC, Monitor, Printer, etc)
Ottima conoscenza degli strumenti del pacchetto Office 365.
Buona padronanza della lingua inglese.


Entra a far parte di una realtà internazionale e innovativa. Il futuro non si aspetta, si sceglie!

#sharingfuture

Title: Oliver Wyman - Data & Analytics Internship - Italy
Description:
Company:

Oliver Wyman

Description:

Who We Are

Oliver Wyman is a global leader in management consulting that combines deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise in strategy, operations, risk management, and organization transformation. Our mission is to help clients achieve lasting success by solving their most complex problems and seizing their biggest opportunities.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation and impact. Our consultants come from a range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work.

At Oliver Wyman, we are proud of the values that we aspire to live by. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.

What is the Digital & Analytics Practice?

Data & Analytics is a specialist business unit within Oliver Wyman, set up in 2017 in Newcastle-upon-Tyne and has since expanded across Europe, including Milan, Berlin, Madrid and Athens. The practice is a dynamic, fast-growing team of quantitative analytics specialists. We work closely with our colleagues across Oliver Wyman to cover a global footprint: Working across multiple industries including but not limited to Financial Services, Insurance, Retail and Transportation.

Clients hire us for our depth of insight and expertise; expertise that comes from specialization. We combine analytical rigour with a relentless focus on client impact. The Italian team has grown to over 50 people, with a mixture of quantitative expertise ranging from Analysts to Directors. We are looking for Entry Level Graduates to pursue a career in quantitative analytics. Working with us offers excellent career and growth opportunities for highly motivated individuals with relevant education in a quantitative subject.

What You Will Do


Internships at Oliver Wyman provide a true taste of life as a consultant and unique preparation for a full-time role.
During your internship, you'll work on challenging projects that have a significant impact on clients, industries, and societies.
You'll be a full team member, with responsibility for a distinct piece of work that will help the team deliver breakthrough impact.
As a member of your project team you'll work alongside colleagues of all levels and clients worldwide to solve complex problems and drive meaningful change.
You'll learn our core business skills, including how to structure your daily tasks.
You will be developing hypotheses, managing data collection, model creation and analyses, Conducting primary and secondary research, creatively tackling information limitations, presenting insights, supporting the delivery of projects



Why join us?


Come aboard if you are excited by challenges and want to work across different cultures.
We want you to step out of your comfort zone and embrace your curiosity.
You'll learn on the job via our apprenticeship model. Much of your focus will be on research and analysis, and you may also have opportunities to begin developing your communication, presentation, and client-management skills.
You'll find genuine colleagues who stand by their beliefs and measure success by the lasting impact you create together.
We believe in flexibility, including the opportunity of hybrid working. You are also invited to join our sport groups and social activities.



What do you look for in applicants?


Students or recent graduates with a master's degree in a quantitative discipline are eligible to apply for this vacancy (ideally Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering degree, Economics and Social Sciences, Quantitative Finance).
Knowledge in using advanced analytics and data manipulation software - SAS, R, SQL, Matlab, or Python.
Excellent command of Italian and English.
Strong analysis, documentation, and communication skills.
Be independent and work under limited supervision respecting defined timelines.
Be able to find innovative, practical and flexible solutions to business issues.
Present effectively results, potential issues and implications
Ability to manage a heavy work volume and meet deadlines in an extremely fast paced environment.
Ability to maintain and respect confidentiality.
Willingness to travel occasionally.
You are aged 18 or over at the start of the internship.
You are Italian resident/have the right to work in Italy.



How to apply?

Please submit your CV and cover letter. If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website .

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn , Instagram or Twitter . Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.

Recruitment Timeline

All year around.

  • Internships at Oliver Wyman provide a true taste of life as a consultant and unique preparation for a full-time role.
  • During your internship, you'll work on challenging projects that have a significant impact on clients, industries, and societies.
  • You'll be a full team member, with responsibility for a distinct piece of work that will help the team deliver breakthrough impact.
  • As a member of your project team you'll work alongside colleagues of all levels and clients worldwide to solve complex problems and drive meaningful change.
  • You'll learn our core business skills, including how to structure your daily tasks.
  • You will be developing hypotheses, managing data collection, model creation and analyses, Conducting primary and secondary research, creatively tackling information limitations, presenting insights, supporting the delivery of projects


Why join us?

  • Come aboard if you are excited by challenges and want to work across different cultures.
  • We want you to step out of your comfort zone and embrace your curiosity.
  • You'll learn on the job via our apprenticeship model. Much of your focus will be on research and analysis, and you may also have opportunities to begin developing your communication, presentation, and client-management skills.
  • You'll find genuine colleagues who stand by their beliefs and measure success by the lasting impact you create together.
  • We believe in flexibility, including the opportunity of hybrid working. You are also invited to join our sport groups and social activities.


What do you look for in applicants?

  • Students or recent graduates with a master's degree in a quantitative discipline are eligible to apply for this vacancy (ideally Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering degree, Economics and Social Sciences, Quantitative Finance).
  • Knowledge in using advanced analytics and data manipulation software - SAS, R, SQL, Matlab, or Python.
  • Excellent command of Italian and English.
  • Strong analysis, documentation, and communication skills.
  • Be independent and work under limited supervision respecting defined timelines.
  • Be able to find innovative, practical and flexible solutions to business issues.
  • Present effectively results, potential issues and implications
  • Ability to manage a heavy work volume and meet deadlines in an extremely fast paced environment.
  • Ability to maintain and respect confidentiality.
  • Willingness to travel occasionally.
  • You are aged 18 or over at the start of the internship.
  • You are Italian resident/have the right to work in Italy.


How to apply?

Please submit your CV and cover letter. If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website .

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn , Instagram or Twitter . Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.

Recruitment Timeline

All year around.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Chi siamo?

Huware è una cloud consulting company da 20 anni in prima linea nella trasformazione digitale

delle aziende. I suoi progetti si basano sulle migliori tecnologie, è premier partner di Google Cloud,

Google Workspace, Salesforce, LumApps, AODocs e monday.com. Grazie alla sua esperienza in

ambito cloud, data, digital transformation e artificial intelligence accompagna le aziende in

un’evoluzione che mette persone e sostenibilità al centro.


Le caratteristiche di uno Huro:

Ci chiamiamo Huroes perché, come ogni eroe che si rispetti, abbiamo una mission: aiutare persone, team e aziende a trasformare le sfide tecnologiche in opportunità.

Trasparenza, inclusione, responsabilità, curiosità, collaborazione, coerenza e solidarietà sono i nostri valori, che applichiamo in azienda e con clienti e partner.

Infine, sostenibilità: ogni Huro è attivamente coinvolto nei progetti di Corporate Social Responsibility di Huware, che ci caratterizzano e definiscono in quanto Società Benefit.


Chi cerchiamo?

Per la nostra Unit Data, non vediamo l’ora di conoscere nuovi profili con differenti seniority che andranno a ricoprire il ruolo:

Data Engineer

Le figure ricercate andranno a supportare l’attuale team di Data nella creazione e ottimizzazione di data pipelines all’interno di progetti di data analysis.

Il/la candidato/a ideale è in grado di creare e ottimizzare data pipelines da zero, tramite gli strumenti messi a disposizione della Google Cloud Platform nell’ambito Big Data. Parteciperà alla realizzazione di progetti direttamente presso clienti in Italia e all’estero.


Quali saranno le attività:

  • Lavorare a stretto contatto con gli stakeholders inclusi Executive, Product, Data e Design teams per fornire assistenza su temi legati ai dati per risolvere problematiche tecniche e disegnare soluzioni infrastrutturali necessarie.
  • Identificare, disegnare e implementare processi migliorativi: automazione di processi manuali, ottimizzazione della distribuzione dei dati, ridisegno dell’infrastruttura esistente per offrire un’ampia scalabilità;
  • Disegnare Data models per il trattamento, l’ottimizzazione e la trasformazione dei dati per soddisfare le esigenze di business;
  • Creare e mantenere in maniera ottimale data pipelines;
  • Costruire datasets complessi e di grandi dimensioni per soddisfare le esigenze di business dei clienti;
  • Costruire l’infrastruttura richiesta per ottimizzare estrazione, trasformazione e caricamento dei dati da un’ampia gamma di data sources usando SQL e tecnologie GCP ‘big data’ come BigQuery;


Quali competenze ricerchiamo:

  • Conoscenza di SQL ed esperienza su database relazionali, gestione dei permessi di accesso ai dati maturate in precedenti esperienze lavorative;
  • Esperienza nella creazione e ottimizzazione di ‘big data’ data pipelines, architetture e data sets;
  • Esperienza nella gestione di root cause analysis sui processi riguardanti i dati per correggere o migliorare le pipelines esistenti;
  • Esperienza nella manipolazione, elaborazione ed estrazione di valori da datasets di grandi dimensioni;
  • Conoscenza di message queuing, stream processing, highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores;
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese sia scritta che parlata;
  • Spiccate doti di project management;
  • Sono ritenute preferenziali le conoscenze di piattaforme di Google Cloud Platform e tecnologie legate al Data Mesh.


Cosa offriamo ai nostri Huroes:

  • Strumentazioni aziendali per il lavoro quotidiano;
  • Hybrid work (Smart working ma non solo!);
  • Learning & Development: percorsi di apprendimento per migliorare le proprie competenze;
  • Sede lavorativa nel quartiere Isola a Milano;
  • Un casale nelle Marche in cui lavorare, riunirsi e invitare familiari e amici;
  • Give Back: Progetti di sostenibilità ambientale e sociale;
  • Team giovane e affiatato;
  • Rimborso spese KM e prenotazione macchina aziendale per eventuali trasferte;
  • Contratto a tempo indeterminato e definizione di RAL e MBO.

Title: DATA ENGINEER
Description:
Covisian S.p.A è un gruppo internazionale , partner di oltre 150 clienti attraverso le sue 25.000 persone che operano in 38 sedi in 7 paesi diversi e un fatturato annuo di 400 milioni di euro circa. In Italia siamo presenti con 13 sedi su tutto il territorio e gestiamo oltre 50 clienti leader in diversi settori. Lo facciamo coniugando interesse collettivo e logiche di mercato, forte dinamismo e cultura dell’inclusività, performance e accountability. Se vuoi entrare a far parte della nostra squadra consulta le nostre posizioni aperte e trova l’opportunità più adatta a te!

Posizione:

La figura ricercata lavorerà nell’ambito dello sviluppo, del mantenimento e dell’evoluzione di una piattaforma di reportistica capace di gestire grandi quantità di dati. L’architettura attuale della piattaforma include dei database e dei Data Lake e consente al team di analisi e di reportistica di costruire tutti i report mediante diversi strumenti di Business Intelligence.

La figura cercata lavorerà sul backend, spesso con servizi Amazon Web Services (AWS), come: Lambda, Aurora DB (MySQL), S3, Glue, Athena, Kinesis, ed altri data service.

Responsabilità:


Implementazione e mantenimento di Data Pipeline aventi la reportistica come target, in Python
Progettazione e sviluppo di applicazioni web backend ed API efficienti ed estendibili utilizzando principalmente JavaScript e Node.js.
Mantenimento ed evoluzione di basi di dati e di Data Lake
Sviluppo di applicazioni back-end ed API data-driven


Cosa offriamo:


RAL ed un inquadramento commisurati sulla base dell’esperienza maturata e capacità possedute
Un ambiente giovane, dinamico e soprattutto Smart
Continue sfide tecnologiche
Possibilità di lavoro da remoto


Requisiti:


Conoscenza di base del linguaggio Python
Conoscenza del linguaggio JavaScript e (preferibilmente) di Node.js
Conoscenza dei DBRM e del linguaggio SQL, come delle principali operazioni di creazione, evoluzione, ottimizzazione e mantenimento di un database relazionale
Costituisce un plus, potenzialmente determinante per la selezione, la conoscenza dei principali AWS Data Service e di Spark, PySpark e Apache Iceberg.
Predisposizione allo studio e apprendimento di nuove tecnologie
Predisposizione al lavoro in team, alla scrittura di test e alla produzione della documentazione per ogni sviluppo
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese parlata e scritta, con autonomia nelle call e in tutte le comunicazioni in inglese.


Altre informazioni:

La ricerca è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi. Gli interessati sono invitati a prendere visione dell'informativa sul trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi della normativa applicabile, in particolare ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento (UE) n. 2016/679 (GDPR).

Title: Sales Business Analyst
Description:
Siamo alla ricerca di un profilo di Sales Business Analyst per un'importante azienda. La posizione è aperta per una persona altamente motivata e con una solida formazione in economia.




Responsabilità:

- Analizzare i dati di vendita e le performance aziendali per identificare le tendenze e le opportunità di crescita

- Elaborare report e presentazioni per supportare la strategia di vendita e le decisioni aziendali

- Collaborare con il team di vendita per sviluppare piani di azione e obiettivi di vendita

- Monitorare e valutare l'efficacia delle strategie di vendita implementate

- Fornire supporto analitico al team di vendita per migliorare l'efficienza e l'efficacia delle attività commerciali




Requisiti:

- Laurea in economia o in materie economiche

- Esperienza di almeno 1 anno in ruoli di controllo o analisi aziendale

- Capacità relazionali e proattive

- Mentalità analitica e precisione

- Orientamento agli obiettivi

- Capacità di lavorare in un ambiente di sfida e di gestire situazioni di lavoro sotto pressione







Contratto:

- Contratto in somministrazione di 12 mesi

- Disponibilità oraria: full time




Se ritieni di possedere le competenze e le qualifiche richieste, invia il tuo curriculum vitae aggiornato all'indirizzo: onsite.samca@adecco.it, sarai contattato/a per un colloquio di selezione.







I candidati, nel rispetto del D.lgs. 198/2006, D.lgs 215/2003 e D.lgs 216/2003, sono invitati a leggere l'informativa sulla privacy (Regolamento UE n. 2016/679).

Facsimile di domanda è disponibile al seguente link.

ATTENZIONE: Abbiamo rilevato la presenza in rete di molti annunci falsi; prendi visione dei nostri consigli per riconoscere i tentativi di truffa al seguente link.

Title: Junior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo è un gruppo bancario internazionale, leader in Italia e fra i primi 5 gruppi dell'area euro con oltre 20 milioni di clienti in Italia e all’estero. Estremamente innovativo è anche motore di crescita sostenibile e inclusiva, con impatto concreto sulla società e con un forte impegno per l’ambiente.

Scopo e Attività

Nell'ambito del perimetro della Direzione Data & Artificial Intelligence Office struttura all'interno dell'area di Governo Chief Data, A.I, Innovation and Technology officer , siamo alla ricerca di un Junior Machine Learning che collaborerà con i gruppi di progetto in ambito Machine Learning per l’incapsulamento dei modelli e delle loro logiche di orchestrazione delle funzionalità software, garantendone robustezza e scalabilità.

Per il nostro gruppo, siamo alla ricerca di un Machine Learning Engineer. Le tue attività includeranno:


Partecipazione a diverse fasi dei progetti di Machine Learning, in particolare
Setup per definire le necessità architetturali e di strumenti
Creazione di prototipi software per la gestione di pipeline di dati e modelli
Ingegnerizzazione del codice in forma di pipeline che soddisfino i requisiti funzionali
ottimizzazione del codice con particolare attenzione a
Scalabilità
Robustezza
Modularità

secondo gli standard degli ambienti di produzione.

Esperienza Richiesta

Fino a 2 anni di esperienza in ruoli analoghi.

Qualifiche Richieste, Skills e Competenze


Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica o Matematica, Data Science, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica o relativi ambiti quantitativi.
Esperienze in Python.
Esperienze con il versionamento del codice software (ad es. Git).
Familiarità con data manipulation in python
Familiarità con librerie di ML (es. scikit-learn, torch ed altri progetti)
Conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese (sia parlato che scritto).


Rappresentano Un Plus


Esperienze in software testing.
Esperienze nell’implementazione di pipeline AI/ML (feature engineering, modeling, performance evaluation, ecc.) in python
Esperienze in DB SQL e NoSQL (MongoDB, Neo4J)
Esperienze con Kubernetes (RH Openshift).
Esperienze con Google Cloud Platform
Esperienze in strumenti di big data (Spark, Kafka…)


Entra a far parte di una realtà internazionale e innovativa. Il futuro non si aspetta, si sceglie!

#sharingfuture

DAIExp

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.




To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.




For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.




A few examples of your responsibilities

Analyze and pull insights from vast amounts of data, spotting high-value opportunities to improve our decision-making.
Design, build, and maintain databases and automated data processes, leveraging internal Python libraries and Google BigQuery, with a focus on clarity, consistency, and accuracy of data across various platforms and systems.
Bring polished data to the final decision-makers, building pipelines and dashboards that offer insights into the performance of products, marketing campaigns, and more.
Collaborate closely with our engineering and data science teams to ensure data reliability, scalability, and accuracy.
Stay informed of industry trends and technologies, and actively participate in the formulation of best practices and standards.




What we look for

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.




What we offer

Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of €52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.




Commitment & contract

Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.




Location

Milan (Italy) or fully remote.




Before you apply

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don’t hesitate to apply.




The selection process

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.




Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.




Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

  • Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
  • An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
  • Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of €52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
  • All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment & contract

Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.


Location

Milan (Italy) or fully remote.


Before you apply

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don’t hesitate to apply.


The selection process

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.


Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.


Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Pour notre division Production, nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera la récolte, l'analyse et l'interprétation des données afin d’élaborer des stratégies d'amélioration pour le site de Production des Acacias.

Responsabilités


Contribuer activement à différentes initiatives du site en établissant les indicateurs clés pour le suivi efficace du projet
Récupérer puis traiter des données issues de sources variées telles que ERP, PLM, MES, LES, ou directement des équipements
Présenter les résultats analysés en utilisant des outils de visualisation de données pour faciliter la compréhension
Comprendre les problématiques métier et les traduire de manière analytique
Collaborer avec le département informatique pour automatiser le traitement des flux de données.
Garder une veille technologique active sur les nouveaux outils et méthodes d'analyse de données


Profil


Ingénieur HES, EPF ou équivalent
Connaissance des outils de traitement et d’analyse de données (Python, Dataiku, Tableau PREP, KNIME ou équivalent), de visualisation (TABLEAU) et base de données
Fortes compétences organisationnelles et autonomie
Aisance relationnelle, écoute, capacité de synthèse et communication efficace
Dynamisme, flexibilité et esprit d'équipe


Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst for one of our clients in the St Gallen area.




In this role, you will handle the creation and execution of BI analytics, design and model workflows, and drive the optimization and automation of business processes. You'll also be tasked with data analysis and interpretation, developing and overseeing dashboards and reports, and maintaining data quality and accuracy.




If you have a degree in business informatics or computer science, expertise in data analysis and BI, complemented by experience with Python or R, and Power BI or Qlik, and excellent knowledge of German and English, this is the right opportunity for you!




If you want to hear more about this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Title: Client Data Analyst (M/W)
Description:
A master in the Art of Fusion, respecting the tradition and creative vision of the 21st century, Swiss watchmaker Hublot places innovation at the heart of its growth strategy. Driven by a young spirit, resolutely looking to the future, Hublot's teams are constantly looking for innovative concepts, which is Hublot’s trademark. Beyond the development of major watchmaking complications, Hublot is associated with the biggest names in the world of sport, through collaborations with FIFA, UEFA, Kylian Mbappé, Pelé, Usain Bolt and many more. Hublot touches on many varied fields including music - with the famous virtuoso pianist Lang Lang as well as DJ Snake - and art with Daniel Arsham, Samuel Ross or Sang Bleu, among others.




As part of Hublot’s new global Client & Omnichannel Department, which oversees the brand’s client development, client data, client experience and omnichannel transformation, we are looking for a Senior Client Data Analyst to analyze our client data in order to provide concrete insights to the business, as well as oversee our client data and client data roadmap. The candidate should be passionate about big data and the omnichannel mindset, and an agent for change in the brand’s ongoing digital transformation. Come and join the team at our headquarters (HQ) in Nyon to play a key role in the development of our global Client Development & Client Data Division!




Client Data Analyst (M/W)




This role reports directly to the Client Development & Client Data Senior Manager and requires continuous cross-functional collaboration with our HQ Commercial, IT and Marketing Teams, as well as local Market teams.

The Senior Client Data Analyst will be the Hublot HQ “go to” contact for client data at the global level. His or her role will be to enrich the business’ knowledge about our prospects and clients by doing in-depth analyses using data from our multi-channel databases. These analyses will fuel strategic reflection on client behavior, our client segmentation, revenue drivers, loyalty actions as well as contribute to the continuous improvement of client journeys and experiences. He or she will also pilot the HQ Client Data roadmap by working closely with IT and Data teams from HQ, the LVMH Watch & Jewelry Division and LVMH Group.




Main responsibilities:

Client insights, analysis and reporting

Analysis of sell-out, warranty activation and client profile data in order to understand client purchasing behavior and the brand’s revenue drivers
Identify business needs and communicate underlying capabilities which need to be constructed
Consolidation and delivery of analysis results (reports, presentations etc.) including business impacts, conveying complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
Creation and implementation of automated reports for HQ and Market teams
Ad-hoc analysis on specific questions from Markets and the business (demographics, lead management, loyalty, etc.) including recommendations for action plans in collaboration with Commercial and Marketing teams using data visualization tools to support decision-making processes within the organization
Support and advise Client & Omnichannel department on creation and implementation of reports on clienteling, client experience and client journey initiatives to measure impact and ROI

Management of Client Data Projects

Contribute to the development of the Client data strategy and roadmap
Internal owner of prospect and client data: management of data quality, consistency, optimization of data flow across internal systems and improvement of data by monitoring of monthly KPIs. Implementation of corrective actions if necessary.
Monitor compliance with the HQ DPO, IT, Data and Legal department (GDPR, PIPL etc.)
Implement Client Data Governance policies, standards and procedures as defined by the Head of Data (IT)
Internal business owner of client segmentation, including its evolution
Implement roadmap in coordination with IT teams, Division and Group.
Support and coordinate client data IT transformation projects with the Division and LVMH Group
Propose AI project to boost sales and client loyalty business challenges.
Participation in Hublot Data governance committee
Stay informed about industry best practices and emerging trends in data analysis and stewardship and share with internal stakeholders




Profile:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics or Mathematics
Minimum 5 years’ experience as Client Data Analyst or exploitation specialist
Essential analytical competencies including datamining statistics
Expertise of Excel, CRM systems, data visualization tools (Power BI), data analytics languages and platforms (SQL, Dataiku)
Ability to manage technical cross-functional projects
Must embrace challenges, be comfortable with ambiguity and possesses a proactive, solution-oriented mindset
Problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
Ability to interact smoothly with different departments and levels of hierarchy
Motivation and true willingness to work cross-functionally
Experience in luxury retail sector a plus
Team player, energetic and results oriented
Fluent in English and French (any additional languages are a plus)
Ability to travel, 5-10% of the time, including internationally
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist

Title: Stagiaire Business insights analyst Intern
Description:
About Us:

CHANEL is a dynamic and innovative player in the travel retail industry, committed to delivering exceptional experiences for our global customers. As part of our continued growth, we are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Insights Analyst Intern to join our Global Travel Retail Team. This role presents an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our business through insightful data analysis and reporting.

Position Overview:

As a Business Insights Analyst Intern with the Global Travel Retail Team at CHANEL, you will have a versatile role that contributes to both analytical tasks and the strategic communication of findings. You will be responsible for synthesizing business intelligence data, producing monthly reports, and providing actionable insights to drive strategic decision-making. You will play an important role in enhancing our existing data models, ensuring accuracy, and presenting information in a clear and concise manner. The ideal candidate is proficient in Excel and PowerPoint, possesses strong analytical skills, and is a collaborative team player.

Key Responsibilities:



Data Management and Relationship Building:
Cultivate and maintain strong partnerships with travel retail data providers.
Ensure the integrity and reliability of data sources, fostering trust and transparency.
Data Analysis and Recommendations:
Review and validate data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness.
Diligently review data to extract meaningful insights and trends.
Act as a problem solver, proactively identifying areas for improvement and recommending data-driven changes to enhance CHANEL's global presence.
Industry Insight and Trend Analysis:
Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate relevant insights into reports.
Communicate insights to our Travel Retail Teams, keeping CHANEL at the forefront of the industry.
Reporting Excellence:
Contribute to CHANEL's Monthly Reports, providing clarity and context to analyzed data on the travel retail industry.
Curate industry articles to create monthly newsletter adapted to be shared with different teams.
Present information in a clear and concise manner with a keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity.
Utilize Excel, PowerPoint, and other tools to present data in a visually compelling and easy-to-understand format.
Dashboard Maintenance:
Ensure timely updates of the Power BI platform with the latest data for real-time insights.
Contribute to the improvement and expansion of existing data models.
Support and Collaboration:
Assist the Junior Business Intelligence Manager and the Strategic Projects & Insights Director in daily operations.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to achieve common goals and objectives.
Work closely with CHANEL's Global Insight team to help to conduct surveys within airports worldwide.
Responsively address Ad hoc analysis requests and questions from CHANEL colleagues.
Ensure timely and accurate information is provided to guide decision-making.



Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. (e.g., Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science).
Proven experience in data analysis or similar role, preferably in the travel retail and/or luxury industry.
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI. Experience with Power Query is a plus.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Detail-oriented with the ability to simplify complex information.
Keen eye for aesthetic and creative sensitivity, ensuring precision and visual harmony in all aspects of the role.
Proficient in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Internship agreement required
Starting Date :1st January 2025



Join CHANEL's Global Travel Retail Team and contribute to shaping the future of travel retail through insightful data analysis and strategic collaboration !

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Profil du candidat


You hold a master’s degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
You have 2-3 years’ experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.
Show more

  • Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
  • Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
  • Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
  • Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.


Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Title: Data Business Analyst
Description:
Tisseur de liens, créateur de tendances et porteur d’influence depuis plus de 20 ans en Suisse, nous avons l’ambition de devenir le 1er retailleur du pays sur le marché online de la maison.







Vous êtes tenté(e) par de nouveaux défis dans une entreprise au fort potentiel de croissance ? Vous avez envie de grandir professionnellement dans une société qui fait toute sa place à l’humain et à la proactivité ?







Rejoignez un acteur majeur du e-commerce dans le secteur de la mode et de la maison. La Redoute Suisse, filiale d’un groupe français, bénéficie des avantages d’un grand groupe (forte dimension internationale, possibilité d’évolution) et d’une PME (autonomie, confiance managériale).







Pour notre filiale basée en Suisse, à Montreux, au sein de notre département IT-Data nous recherchons un(e) :







Data Business Analyst à 100%







VOS MISSIONS




Véritable business partenaire, ses clients sont transverses et ses partenaires principaux sont l’IT, la finance, la logistique, le marketing produit et la relation client.




Il identifie les besoins en data de la filiale selon les axes d’analyses formulés par le plan stratégique de l’entreprise et les besoins des business partners.




Via des extractions ad hoc, il aide à mettre en place des analyses permettant d’optimiser des processus métier et de faciliter la prise de décision.




Dans le cadre du plan de transformation de l’entreprise, il accompagne les équipes projets à cadrer les besoins, comprendre les enjeux et en mesurer la performance




Dans ce sens, il met à disposition des utilisateurs et business partners des data fiables sous la forme de tables, modèle de données, tableaux et bord et reporting (Excel, Power BI, Power Query…).




Il est garant du maintien, de la véracité et de la mise à jour des reporting existants.




Il met à disposition des équipes marketing et de contrôle de gestion les données et outils nécessaires à la construction du budget et des forecast.










VOTRE PROFIL




Formation équivalent Master en statistique / économétrie, master spécialisé Big data ou bien en HEG/HEC avec une spécialisation data science / analytics
Expérience souhaitée de 2 ans minimum sur un poste similaire.
Orientation et sensibilité business forte afin de comprendre les enjeux de l’entreprise
Parfaites connaissances en langages SQL standard, DAX, Power Query et de l’environnement Power BI (éventuellement Python)
Parle couramment Français et Anglais
Sens de l’organisation, capable de gérer plusieurs projets en même temps
Curiosité, dynamisme et esprit d’équipe










NOTRE ENTREPRISE







La Redoute est certifiée Great Place to Work et fut élue 5ème Small Best Workplace en Suisse en 2022 et 2023. La bonne ambiance, l’entre-aide et le cadre de travail sont des atouts reconnus par l’ensemble de nos collaborateurs.




A deux pas de la gare de Montreux et face au lac, la Redoute est idéalement placée et les locaux sont chaleureux et agréables.




Au-delà des nombreuses prestations sociales et avantages collaborateurs, nous tenons à ce que nos collaborateurs conservent un bon équilibre vie privée, vie professionnelle en proposant des heures de travail flexibles, récupérables et en bénéficiant de 2 jours de télétravail par semaine.




Vous vous êtes reconnu dans cette annonce et même si vous ne cochez pas toutes les cases, n’hésitez pas à nous adresser votre dossier de candidature complet, car vous êtes peut-être la personne que nous recherchons.

Title: Analytics & Insights - Paid Internship (m/f/x)
Description:
Job Location

Petit-Lancy

Job Description

Position: Analytics & Insights - Paid Internship (m/f/x)

Location: Geneva

Do you have passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision, media landscape? Passion to drive the change, through deep consumer understanding and front-edge advanced analytics? And finally, are you available for a 6-months internship?

Then, this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it & how we can we influence them, through immersive exploration and data analytics.

We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.

A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.

Your role as an Analytics & Insights Intern :


You will act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G management in several business domains (consumer, costumer, digital, …);
You will be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth;
You will combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions;
You will grow your skills day-in, day-out, improving your mastery in data analytics as well as immersive in-depth research. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal & external guides worldwide.


What we offer:


Responsibilities as of Day 1 – You will be given concrete projects and feel the ownership for them from the beginning
Continuous Growth through working on real business challenges and mentoring– you will work with a team and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager, ensuring your skillset will grown day in-day out.
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and respectful work environment – We live our Purpose, Values, and Principles daily. We value every individual and encourage initiatives promoting agility and work/life balance.


Job Qualifications

What we are looking for:

Masters Students with:


Strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a “can-do” approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Ability to play a key role and influence across levels and functions.
Boundless curiosity and un-sane passion to generate results
Data Analytics background a plus


Additional expertise/certifications on the following areas will be valued but not required:


Work experience or certification in Market Research Techniques (Quantitative or Qualitative methods)
Work experience or certification in Visualization, Data transformation tools and/or programming (Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI , JMP, SQL, R or Python, Alteryx, KNIME, RapidMiner)


WHO WE ARE:

P&G is one of the world’s largest consumer goods companies and home to iconic, loved and trusted brands, such as Dash®, Gillette®, Pantene®, Oral-B®, Swiffer®, Head & Shoulders®, Braun®, Fairy®.

For over 180 years, Procter & Gamble has grown in the market and changed the way business is done, thanks to Talents. We value leadership as well as mastery and offer fulfilling career opportunities that make us an unbeatable force in our industry.

At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Due to legal restrictions, immigration sponsorship is available only for EU/EFTA nationalities. All candidates with nonEU/EFTA nationalities are encouraged to check out opportunities in countries where they can obtain a work permit.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000114493

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer in Zurich, Switzerland




Location - Zurich (Hybrid)

Role- Data Engineer (Permanent)

Industry - Energy

(Python, SQL, GCP)




Are you a Data Engineer with 5+ years of experience, ready to take your career to new heights? If you’re passionate about data and eager to work on groundbreaking projects, we want you on our team in Zurich!




The ideal Data Engineer will have:

Experience: 5+ years in data engineering with a history of delivering impactful projects.
Skills: Advanced proficiency in SQL, Python, and GCP.
Analytical Mindset: A visionary thinker who turns complex data into actionable insights.




Benefits of the role:

Generous Vacation Policy: Enjoy 6 weeks of paid vacation every year.
Wellness Benefits: Free access to top gyms and wellness programs to keep you at your best.
Flexible Work Arrangements: Enjoy a hybrid work model that suits your lifestyle.




Salary: 60,000 – 85,000 CHF




Location: Zurich




If interested, please apply directly or reach out to h.lai@interex-group.com for further details

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Responsabilità:


Collaborare e comunicare in modo efficace con differenti cross-functional teams per definire e raccogliere i requisiti sui dati.
Supportare le analisi in gestione al business:

Redigere specifiche tecnico/funzionali per il team di sviluppo nel contesto DataWarehouses.
Implementare processi di import e storicizzazione del dato in modalità batch/near real time nel contesto DataLake [BigQuery su piattaforma Google Cloud].


Ottimizzare l'architettura delle varie data platform per le esigenze aziendali.
Documentare le pipeline di dati, i processi e le best practice per una corretta condivisione con il team.


Competenze Richieste:


3+ anni di esperienza e familiarità con data warehousing e cloud platforms in ambito servizi finanziari.
Conoscenza esperta di SQL e Python (librerie pandas, numpy).
2+ anni di esperienza su Google Cloud BigQuery e altri servizi di Google Cloud Platform.
Capacità di ottimizzare i processi e l'infrastruttura dei dati in termini di efficienza, scalabilità ed economicità.
Conoscenza di JIRA e di altri strumenti di gestione del lavoro Agile (Confluence).


Competenze Aggiuntive (Plus):


Conoscenze di Tool di Data Visualization (ad esempio Power BI).
Conoscenze di Qlik Replicate.
Esperienze recenti nel ruolo di Cloud Data Architect.


Capacità Richieste:


Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.
Attitudine analitica e orientamento al problem solving.
Attitudine alla comunicazione e al lavoro in team.
Proattività.


Desired Skills and Experience

Experis è una società leader a livello globale nel campo del reperimento di risorse umane e nelle soluzioni per la forza lavoro basate su progetti. Con sede in oltre 50 paesi, Experis fornisce talenti di alta qualità e soluzioni innovative per aiutare le aziende a raggiungere i propri obiettivi commerciali. I servizi offerti includono il reclutamento di personale specializzato nell'IT e nell'ingegneria, la gestione di progetti, il reclutamento professionale e i servizi gestiti. Concentrandosi sull'offrire esperienza e valore ai clienti in svariati settori, Experis aiuta le aziende a superare le sfide della forza lavoro attuale e a raggiungere il successo.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ein spannendes KMU mit Fokus auf erneuerbare Energie und Telekommunikationsservices, sucht nach einem Business Intelligence Analyst für das Team in Raum St Gallen. Es handelt sich hierbei um eine neue Position, daher auch mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum!




Deine Aufgaben

Entwicklung und Implementierung von BI-Analytics zur Unterstützung geschäftlicher Entscheidungen
Konzeption, Modellierung und Realisierung von Workflows sowie Unterstützung bei der Optimierung und Automatisierung von Geschäftsprozessen
Analyse und Interpretation von Daten sowie Erstellung und Verwaltung von Dashboards und Berichten (inkl. Dokumentation)
Sicherstellung der Datenqualität und -integrität




Dein Profil

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, BWL oder einem verwandten Bereich
Erste Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse und im BI-Bereich
Kenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Phyton und/oder R sowie in Anwendungen wie Power BI sind von Vorteil
Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse




Perks and benefits:

Flache Hierarchien und dynamisches Umfeld
Sehr gute berufliche Vorsorge
Starke Weiterbildungsprogramme
Regionale Vergünstigungen







BITTE BEACHTEN: Das Einzige, was Du tun musst, ist Dein Konto erstellen auf TieTalent und DAS WAR'S 🙂 + ES IST KOSTENLOS für Talents! Du wirst Dich nicht für diese spezifische Position bewerben, sondern wenn es eine Übereinstimmung mit dieser Gelegenheit gibt, wirst Du kontaktiert und bekommst mehr Details darüber.

Title: Data Engineer (100% Remote - Switzerland)
Description:
About The Job

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code to construct data pipelines.
Work closely with data scientists and analysts to understand and fulfill their data requirements.
Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of data pipelines.
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
Maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Collaborate with teams to integrate systems.
4+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Experience with machine learning algorithms and libraries.
Familiarity with data visualization tools.
Show more

  • Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
  • Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases.
  • Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
  • Strong project management and organizational skills.
  • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
  • Experience with machine learning algorithms and libraries.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools.

Title: Finance Process & Data Analyst
Description:
Be part of an exciting journey by supporting Richemont International SA (RISA) Finance, based in Fribourg, in our transformation into a more standardized, automated, and data-driven department.

As a member of the RISA Finance Digital Transformation team, you will act as an internal consultant to lead automation and process improvement initiatives across various teams within RISA Finance (Accounting, Financial Planning, Treasury, and ICS).

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

PROCESS


Gather, validate, and document business requirements
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation
Support business transition and drive change management (working closely with end users)
Manage projects according to set requirements, milestones and deadlines
Engage with key stakeholders (technical and non-technical) at every stage of an initiative
Deliver presentations and project walkthroughs to a wide-ranging audience composed of various levels of seniority in the organization


TOOLS


Identify most suitable technical solution for each use case
Implement and coordinate implementation of solutions using selected tools
Design to-be solutions, perform testing and coordinate go-live activities
Ensure proper documentation, maintenance, and continuous improvement of existing products (i.e., Chatbot, Power Automate flows, Power BI dashboards)


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Mandatory


You hold a university degree in business, finance, computer science or similar
You bring a minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience in an international environment
You have experience with agile project management
You are hands on with low-code automation tools (i.e., Power Apps, UiPath, Celonis or similar)
You speak English and French fluently
You have a strategic mindset, capable of presenting findings and recommendations
You are a good team player
You are curious, open minded and like to independently search for an innovative solutions


Desirable


Experience in database management
Knowledge of SQL, Python, or any other programming language
Understanding of the basic financial concepts (i.e., Purchase to Pay)
Experience in using SAP (or any other ERP solution) or Anaplan
Experience in developing BI solutions (using Power BI, Tableau, Looker or similar)


WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.


We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity
We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity
We care for the world we live in


Your Journey With Us

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will provide an answer promptly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will then be a face-to-face interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.
